variants.name: A53T
variants.description: Human α-synuclein with alanine (L) at position 53 replaced by threonine (T).

evaluation.Step 1: Yes, functional assays (fluorescence-based) were used to assess aggregation kinetics.
evaluation.Step 2: The substitutions are known to affect protein function related to aggregation.
evaluation.Step 4: Statistical analyses or OddsPath calculations suggest a strong pathogenic effect.

variants.name: S87N
variants.description: Human α-synuclein with serdeline (H) at position 87 replaced by asparagine (N).

evaluation.Step 1: Yes, functional assays (fluorescence-based) were used to assess aggregation kinetics.
evaluation.Step 2: The substitutions are known to affect protein function related to aggregation.
evaluation.Step 4: Statistical analyses or OddsPath calculations suggest a strong pathogenic effect.

variants.name: A53T/S87N
variants.description: Human α-synuclein with alanine (L) at position 53 replaced by threonine (T) and serdeline (H) at position 87 replaced by asparagine (N).

evaluation.Step 1: Yes, functional assays (fluorescence-based) were used to assess aggregation kinetics.
evaluation.Step 2: The substitutions are known to affect protein function related to aggregation.
evaluation.Step 4: Statistical analyses or OddsPath calculations suggest a strong pathogenic effect.
